Summary I am a solid individual contributor and strong team player interested in being part of a group that’s making a difference. 
 
Here are some of the Non-Technical skills I would bring to your organization: 
--Superior written and verbal communication skills 
--Friendly and approachable team player 
--Ability to multitask 
--Hard-working and focused 
--Ability to successfully work with database administrators/system administrators/core systems developers/content teams/project management teams to meet customer needs and specifications 
--Strong belief in producing tested products of high quality and supportability 
--A sense of humor (appropriate to the workplace) that makes work more fun for everyone 
 
And these are some of the Technical skills and Experience I would bring to your organization:

Experience Senior Software Developer Stanford University September 2012  –  September 2014  (2 years 1 month) Stanford, California Bioinformatics Developer III Proteostasis Therapeutics, Inc. January 2009  –  November 2012  (3 years 11 months) Proteostasis Therapeutics Incorporated •	Led a three person team to develop the PN Explorer – software that stores, manages, analyzes, and visualizes both disease and compound data. 
•	Created novel 3D Landscape visualization - an interactive display that layers protein-protein interaction, microarray, and proteomics data onto a three-dimensional, animated landscape. 
•	Implemented the Gene Query tool, a powerful tool which allows users to compare a list of genes of interest across all microarray and proteomics datasets in our database with user set fold-change and p-value cutoffs and interactive visualization of results. Research Assistant Whitehead Institute June 2008  –  September 2008  (4 months) Cambridge, MA •	Advised by Hui Ge 
•	Studied the effects of perturbations across the human proteome to identify genes related to infertility. 
•	Created a framework to work with multiple large-scale data sets and implemented several topological algorithms. 
•	Developed software that allows users to easily perform all of this analysis on their laptops. Research Assistant and Software Developer for the Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) February 2008  –  September 2008  (8 months) Cambridge, MA •	Advised by Leonid Chindelevitch, Jerome Waldispuhl, and Bonnie Berger 
•	Developed an algorithm to align two protein-protein interaction networks, in order to identify homologous genes. 
•	Worked to consolidate a number of large-scale data sets and helped to implement a quadratic minimization algorithm. 
•	Investigated several approaches to modeling Trans-membrane Beta-Barrel Proteins - found in the outer membranes of many disease causing bacteria such as E. coli and Salmonella. These proteins are important drug targets and are difficult to study experimentally. Research Assistant and Software Developer for the Data Laboratory Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) January 2008  –  January 2008  (1 month) Cambridge, MA •	Advised by David Brock 
•	Studied the linguistics of sentence structure and developed an application to convert output from several sentence parsers into a more standardized form. Created a sentence parse tree visualizer. Chem Lab Intern Intel June 2007  –  September 2007  (4 months) •	Analyzed demand data for the chemical laboratory supporting a semiconductor fabrication plant.  
•	Collected twelve years of historical data by creating a program that interfaced with the lab data storage system. 
•	Investigated and implemented a number of time series analysis techniques in order to create a program to predict future demand. Summary Sudha is an Engineering professional who has web and backend development experience across a wide variety of technologies including J2SE, J2EE, LDAP, JSF, Spring and database programming. Sudha offers significant abilities in the areas of analysis, software development, test driven approach, quality architecture and release management. Sudha's experience spans a broad range of business and technical domains. 
 
Sudha is an engineer who is committed to implement innovative and elegant technical solutions. Focusing on quality and business imperatives is a core value of mine, one that I bring to every project on which I work.
